fields.description:
If there's an error during autosave, a message is returned in the UI, but the buttons are left disabled. The only option then is a page refresh to continue with the comment. And if you don't add your comment to your clipboard it's lost.

The buttons need to be re-enabled, or perhaps replaced by a refresh button with a suitable warning!

!https://img.skitch.com/20110131-g8ygcsdhciqrgyx8g35ctii57u.jpg!
fields.summary: If there's an error during autosave, a message is returned, but the buttons are left disabled. They need to be reenabled!

fields.description:
To reproduce:
# Commit changes
# Wait for the changeset to appear in the Activity Stream
# Create a Review from the Stream item
# Reload the Stream and there'll be no indication of the Review
# Load the Changeset page and there'll be no indocation of the Review
# Load the Review and it's all in perfectly good working order
# Load the associated JIRA and it appears in the Review tab


Raise this:
!https://img.skitch.com/20110131-8jhug38tqrykmhst9rn4jkwukr.jpg!

And check its display across the products:
!https://img.skitch.com/20110131-f4s2wghaifcynpcia91swb7umc.jpg!
fields.summary: Reviews aren't being associated with Changeset pages or Changeset items in the Activity Stream

fields.description:
Here's what we're looking at:
h4. MUSTS
    * PlainJake: MAJOR: Wrong file type icons: https://img.skitch.com/20110127-r7w5c3shq668bk45ywfcqghxi8.jpg
    * seb: BUG: file name in diff results should have a title saying "show diff" https://skitch.com/sebruiz/rmqr2/search-quit
    * seb: MINOR: The Repository link on the right hand side should a) have a title which says "Go to REPO changelog" b) force the view to commit mode (imho, you want to see commits from diff results)
    * Adam: BUG IE7 - each branch in a result ends up on a new line - needs to be floated? http://content.screencast.com/users/AdamAtlassian/folders/Jing/media/ffdf8dd8-d971-4c90-a813-845f3e63a48f/floating%20issue.pn AND calamity: BUG:IE8 linewraps in filepath results when there is plenty of space http://screencast.com/t/Z7bFN1Ji
    * Adam: IE7 - search box misaligned http://content.screencast.com/users/AdamAtlassian/folders/Jing/media/47be4855-e6c2-4af3-9005-4dd1c8acf4a0/IE7%20search%20misaligned.png
    * calamity: BUG: IE8 content font is HUGE http://screencast.com/t/yiav5nKt

h4. NICE TO HAVES
    * seb: MINOR: Wording and styling of "no results found" dialog could be improved https://skitch.com/sebruiz/rmqrf/search-quit
    * timp: MINOR: whole search category div is highlighted on hover, but only text is clickable http://screencast.com/t/axiO8lJKlOL
    * PlainJake: MINOR: Diff icon on something that links to a changeset. One of these needs to change: https://img.skitch.com/20110127-11m7m4mgeukdt9pnhxg4xnbaay.jpg
    * jason: MINOR spacing issues on committer results page https://skitch.com/jhinch/rmqgy/search-matt
    * seb: BUG: Layouting inconsistencies between changesets and content results MINOR: diff
    * seb: MINOR: "77 matching changeset diffs in all repositories" sounds weird. could be reworded to "77 diffs in all repositories"
    * seb: MINOR: styling inconsistency with file history https://skitch.com/sebruiz/rmqgq/search-connector
    * AnnaB: MINOR - layout difference between IE7 and firefox https://img.skitch.com/20110127-ntn9eyd47day6yc1fme33nd4wn.jpg

fields.description:
On load, Hibernate does not add entries to map relations where map _values_ are null. Oracle's treatment of empty strings causes nulls to appear in cru_fr_detail.cru_value so when we later try to add an empty string value to the Map, on flush() Hibernate tries to insert a duplicate row. Yay Oracle. Quality software.

Hibernate [issue|http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/hibernate/browse/HHH-772] and [pertinent comment|http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/hibernate/browse/HHH-772?focusedCommentId=34629&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action_34629]
fields.summary: Under Oracle, creating a review from a changeset fails with constraint violation

fields.description: We "select distinct review from Review review..." which fails under Oracle because distinct applies to all columns but Oracle won't compare CLOBs (and Review has two CLOB columns).
fields.summary: Under Oracle, creating a review from a changeset fails with "ORA-00932: inconsistent datatypes: expected - got CLOB"

Scenario: during upgrade, the FE JIRA plugin is configured to connect to https://atlaseye.atlassian.com.

There is an ApplicationLink using the URL 'https://atlaseye', so the URL matching doesn't quite work.

The end result is that FE thinks these are 2 different FE instances (even though the existing app link is successfully reused)

fields.summary: Transient NPE when viewing Review Coverage Report
Make layout pixel perfect to Jake's Design

fields.description:
currently, diffs are grouped in memory by changeset.
This is costly, and also inaccurate - especially when counting.

Changeset diffs should be displayed per file (diff) rather than changeset - this allows fast (lucene) counting and scoring, as opposed to the current brute-force approach.
fields.summary: Display diffs per file revision, not per changeset

fields.description:
If the lastModified field is missing from the changeset document, a NFE is thrown. This occurs because the index upgrade is still underway.

In this case - don't display a last modified date.
fields.summary: NumberFormatException if search performed before an index upgrade has finished

fields.description: The current FE JIRA plugin upgrade only looks at the "FE Username/password" fields. If the customer is using only basic auth, it will not work properly
fields.summary: Upgrade needs to take into account both FE username/pass and Basic Auth ones

fields.summary: Some repositories in the Repo Dropdown List can't be found

fields.description:
See also: [LUCENE-2666|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-2666].
It appears that a server restart fixes this problem, implying that some cache is not being cleared.
This may be the result of a search being performed at index time, causing a lucene cache to be loaded that is not correctly invalidated when the index has been built?

We need to try and reproduce this locally, and also do an audit of all Lucene IndexReaders and ensure they are being correctly closed, or reopened after an index.commit();,
fields.summary: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown from lucene sometimes after an upgrade

fields.description:
Due to the limit on the number of results returned when a search for changesets is done, many results are being dropped.

Normalizing the data in the METADATA.changeset document would mean there is no need for an in memory munge of the data.


Care must be taken to ensure Advanced Search is not affected by this change.

Ensure all browsers are tested.
Ensure all result types are tested.

fields.description:
Hello.

When you mose over any bar of the Line History chart, the tooltip displays wrong dates.
For example: 
If you mouse over a bar related to 2010, it's displaying the text _"X" file revisions between 2008-02-01 and 2008-02-28_.
The next bar to the right displays the text _"X" file revisions between 2009-08-01 and 2009-08-31_.
The next bar to the right displays the text _"X" file revisions between 2010-01-01 and 2010-01-31_.
The next bar to the right displays the text _"X" file revisions between 2008-12-01 and 2008-12-31_.

And so on...

The same happens with other years.

Please let me know if you need further explanation.

Regards,
Felipe Kraemer
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Line History tooltip displaying wrong dates when moused over

fields.description:
Crucibles sends email notifications with subjects like:
"Edith Tom added 11 revisions to ..."

This is confusing as one commit in svn is a revision, so it seems like 11 commits have been made. I realised though it was actually referring to 11 files that were updated in the review. It would be better if the email said something like
"11 files had revisions added to the review"

fields.description:
Tags copied from directories not indexed by FishEye will not index.

To reproduce:

Create an SVN repo with the following structure:
!http://content.screencast.com/users/AdamAtlassian/folders/Jing/media/10f95348-e1da-45ce-bc75-76afce5e4bdc/2011-01-20_1602.png!

Commit a file to each of project1/trunk and project2/trunk.

{{svn copy project1/trunk project2/tags/copiedAcross}}
{{svn copy project1/trunk project2/branches/copiedAcross}}
{{svn copy project2/branches/copiedAcross project2/tags/copiedLocally}}

Add a repo to FishEye for project2.  That is:
SVN Url : [path to root]
Path: project2


When browsing the source, project2/branches/copiedAcross and project2/tags/copiedLocally will contain the file in project1/trunk, but project2/tags/copiedAcross will appear empty.
!http://content.screencast.com/users/AdamAtlassian/folders/Jing/media/a7e2191e-049e-476d-b3ff-c0339dae5a95/2011-01-20_1611.png!

Linked support request: [JST-12910|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-12910]
fields.summary: SVN tags aren't indexed properly if created from an outside-repository source.

fields.description:
Currently - when the METADATA index is upgraded, all of the head content will also be upgraded.

We need to version the CONTENT index separately to the METADATA index and allow these to upgraded independently.

From AtlasEye:
{code}
                                                                      
[atlassian]   metadata index took: 243s. 69778 changesets             
[bamboo]   metadata index took: 1207s. 68533 changesets               
[office-connector]   metadata index took: 150s.                       
[public]   metadata index took: 1475s. 7417 changesets                
[intsys]   metadata index took: 417s.                                 
[customware]   metadata index took: 8s.                               
[crowd]   metadata index took: 334s.                                  
[connector-intellij]   metadata index took: 173s.                     
[connector-eclipse]   metadata index took: 470s.                      
[connector-commons]   metadata index took: 28s.                       
[confluence-tools]   metadata index took: 2s.                         
[confluence-plugins]   metadata index took: 39s.                      
[confluence]   metadata index took: 1361s.                            
[jira]   metadata index took: 5903s.                                  
{code}

Content:
{code}
[jira]   content index took: 2508s.
[public]   content index took: 2894s.
[bamboo]   content index took: 792s.
[confluence]   content index took: 2308s.
{code}
fields.summary: Don't perform a content re-index when the METADATA index is upgraded

fields.description:

fields.description:
I generated a backup throught the FishEye 2.4.4 interface.
When I try to restore this backup in a brand-new, different, FishEye 2.4.4 instance using the command {{fisheyectl.bat restore --force -f C:\fecru_backup_2011_01_18.zip}}, the error below is displayed:
{code}
Output: config.xml not found in archive.
Restoring to: jdbc:hsqldb:file:c:\fecru-home/var/data/crudb/crucible
Creating table definitions...
.
.
.
Adding database constraints...
Updating database to latest version...
Backup restored successfully.
{code}
When restoring a backup on Windows, the message {{Output: config.xml not found in archive.}} is displayed. I could not reproduce the error in a Linux instance.

Regards,
Felipe Kraemer
Atlassian Support

fields.description:
In Fisheye/Crucible, watches only send email updates when Fisheye content is updated (i.e. commits).

What we really want is to be able to watch code reviews, and to do so for an entire project.  This will allow those interested to be CC'ed on all code review emails related to the project.

*Workaround* I'm about to setup [rss2email|http://www.allthingsrss.com/rss2email/] to email new posts to the code review feed to a mailing list.
fields.summary: Should be able to watch reviews

fields.description:
The new search only searches on changeset diff and changeset comment.
The old search also supported the user pasting in a csid, and being taken directly to the changeset page.

Something we could support relatively simply would be to also search CSID's when we are doing a changeset search.
This would at least return results when a user does paste in a csid to the quicksearch box.
fields.summary: Searching for CSID doesn't jump to that changeset
